summary: This is a Clerk's Notice of Nonconforming Document from the Clark County, Nevada District Court regarding a civil case between Carmit Pesia Cipolla and Giuseppe Cipolla. The notice indicates that a summons, request, and complaint filed by Carmit Cipolla was initially filed into the wrong case and has been reprocessed into the correct case.

persons.name: Carmit Pesia Cipolla
persons.context: Plaintiff in a civil case against Giuseppe Cipolla, submitted a nonconforming document (Summons, Request and Complaint) that was filed into the incorrect case.

persons.name: Giuseppe Cipolla
persons.context: Defendant in a civil case filed by Carmit Pesia Cipolla.

persons.name: Steven D. Grierson
persons.context: Clerk of the Court for the Clark County District Court; the document is electronically filed under his name.

persons.name: Deborah Rose
persons.context: Deputy Clerk who signed and certified the Clerk's Notice of Nonconforming Document and the Certificate of Service.

connections.description: Plaintiff and Defendant in a civil lawsuit in Clark County, Nevada.

events.title: Filing of Nonconforming Document
events.description: Carmit Cipolla electronically filed a Summons, Request and Complaint that was submitted into an incorrect case.

events.title: Clerk's Notice and Curative Action
events.description: The Clark County District Court Clerk's office issued a notice that the nonconforming document was reprocessed by removing it from the incorrect case and entering it into the correct case.

keyFacts: This document is a procedural court notice regarding a civil case between Carmit Pesia Cipolla and Giuseppe Cipolla, not directly related to the Epstein case.
The notice concerns a filing error where a summons, request, and complaint was initially filed into the wrong case and was subsequently reprocessed.
The document is part of the Epstein case data set (EFTA00151198), but its content appears to be an unrelated civil matter from Clark County, Nevada.
The filing was electronically submitted on April 24, 2020, and the Clerk's Notice was issued on April 27, 2020.
